content:
• Tuesday, June 10, 2014
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia proposes $250M private offering of depositary shares

    • Penn Virginia (PVA) -3.9% AH on news it plans to offer 2.5M depositary shares, each representing a 1/100th interest in a share of Series B convertible perpetual preferred stock, in a private offering.
    • PVA says it intends to use the proceeds from the offering to finance the acceleration of its development program in the Eagle Ford Shale and to increase its lease acquisition effort in the play.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM | 8 Comments

  • After Hour Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ULTA +8.1%. EQIX +5.7%. AVNR +4.5%. BSBR +1.9%. PBR +1.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AMTX -4.3%. UNFI -3.5%. GD -2.9%. DEPO -2.5%. EXC -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon +8.5% AH on FQ1 beat, strong top-line guidance

    • Ulta Salon (NASDAQ:ULTA) expects FQ2 revenue of $706M-$717M and EPS of $0.78-$0.82 vs. a consensus of $704M and $0.82. Comparable store sales are expected to rise 5%-7% Y/Y.
    • FY14 (ends Jan. '15) guidance for 4%-6% comp growth, mid-teens EPS growth, and $100M+ in free cash flow is being reiterated.
    • Comparable store sales rose 8.7% in FQ1 (down slightly from FQ4's 9.2%), aided by a 72.3% increase in e-commerce comps.
    • 21 stores were opened during the quarter, raising total store count to 696. 100 net new openings are expected in FY14.
    • Gross margin was 34.5%, +70 bps Q/Q and -50 bps Y/Y. SG&A spend was 22.8% of revenue, same as a year ago.
    • Expectations were depressed going into earnings.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM
  • SYNA

    Synaptics +17.3% AH after resuming trading

    • Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) has blasted off to new all-time highs after announcing it's buying Renesas' LCD driver IC unit and upping its FQ4 guidance.
    • Shares now +51% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSEC

    Prospect Capital +3.4% after SEC appeal pans out

    • Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) is up 3.4% to $10.15 in after-hours action after coming off trading halt.
    • Previously: Prospect wins appeal with SEC; no restatement necessary
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 26 Comments
  • EXC

    Exelon files to sell 50M shares, 20M equity units

    • Exelon (NYSE:EXC) unveils plans to commence concurrent registered offerings of 50M common shares in connection with forward sales agreements and 20M equity units for an aggregate stated amount of $1B.
    • Proceeds from the offerings will be used to finance a portion of the previously announced acquisition of Pepco Holdings and for general corporate purposes.
    • EXC -1.7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 9 Comments
  • SYNA

    Synaptics buying Renesas unit, ups guidance; Himax lower

    • Synaptics (NASDAQ:SYNA) is acquiring Renesas' (OTCPK:RNECF) LCD driver IC unit in full for $475M in cash, or an enterprise value of $515M. Past reports had Synaptics only initially buying Renesas' 55% stake in the business.
    • The deal is expected to close in calendar Q4, be financed with a combo of cash and $300M in debt financing, and be immediately accretive to EPS. It adds to a broader consolidation wave that has hit the semi industry over the last year.
    • The Renesas unit (#1 in the mobile LCD driver market) had revenue of $650M and cash flow of $100M in the fiscal year ending in March - that means Synaptics is paying only 0.8x trailing sales. Synapitcs (current market cap of $2.4B) predicts the purchase will grow its addressable market by 1.5x, and "accelerate its product roadmap for touch-and-display driver integration."
    • Separately, Synaptics is hiking its FQ4 revenue guidance to $300M-$310M, above a prior $275M-$295M and a $285.8M consensus. The touchpad/touch controller vendor says both mobile and PC demand has been better than expected.
    • Synaptics is halted. Renesas rival Himax (NASDAQ:HIMX) -2.3% AH.
    • Previous: Analyst commentary on Synaptics/Renesas
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

    • Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance (NASDAQ:ULTA): Q1 EPS of $0.77 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $713.77M (+22.5% Y/Y) beats by $14.26M.
    • Shares +6.14% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • PSEC

    Prospect wins appeal with SEC; no restatement necessary

    • Prospect Capital (NASDAQ:PSEC) has been in the penalty box for a few weeks after the SEC asserted certain wholly-owned holding companies needed to be consolidated into its results, but on appeal the SEC staff has agreed with Propsect's rebuttal of that conclusion.
    • Shares are currently halted.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 44 Comments
  • SFUN

    SouFun, E-House, Leju drop on downbeat land sales data

    • Chinese land sales volume fell 24% Y/Y in May in tier-1 cities, 20% in tier-2, and 37% in tier-3, says research firm CREIS. The data comes two weeks after CREIS reported Chinese home prices fell M/M for the first time since June '12.
    • Also: 1) A SouFun (SFUN -5.1%) survey indicates a 19% M/M and 45% Y/Y May drop in land sale transactions across 300 Chinese cities, even though May is a seasonally strong month. 2) A survey of 2014 Chinese home buyers (involved 28K households) suggests only 20% are first-time buyers, down from 48% in 2012.
    • Prof. Gan Li, who handled the latter survey: "The era of Chinese real estate industry being driven by first-time homebuyer demand is over ... The market is going to be driven by investment and improvement in demand that is sensitive to price."
    • E-House (EJ -4.2%) and subsidiary Leju (LEJU -4.5%) have joined SouFun in selling off.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • INO

    Ugly reversal for Inovio

    • After being up as much as13% in today's session, Inovio (INO -14.2%) turns tail and plummets 24% from its intraday high of $12.20 on a 10x surge in volume. On a purely technical basis, the intensity of the bearish reversal should put longs on high alert.
    • Earlier today the company announced the initiation of a Phase 1/2a clinical trial to evaluate the safety, immunogenicity and clinical responses of INO-3112, a combination immunotherapeutic candidate for HPV-associated head and neck cancer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 28 Comments
  • COL

    B/E Aerospace -4.5% as investors had hoped for a sale, not a split-up

    • Investors react negatively to plans by B/E Aerospace (BEAV -4.5%) to split its operations into two independent publicly traded companies, just a month after saying it was considering selling itself, sending shares down nearly 5%.
    • Separating the businesses may allow each to "benefit from increased management focus and operational flexibility," as co-CEO Amin Khoury said, but it also could result in a smaller sale in the future.
    • "As two standalone entities, it could theoretically make it easier for a potential acquirer to make a bid without having to worry about the other half of the business," RBC analyst Robert Stallard says, adding that comments in a post-announcement call point to a "a multi-part transaction, that invariably means that it will take some time to come together."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Keurig Green Mountain perks up after Subway deal

    • Shares of Keurig Green Mountain (GMCR +1.4%) trade higher after the company announces a new deal to bring its products to Subway outlets.
    • Keurig says half of the Subway restaurants in the U.S. and Canada have adopted a Keurig system.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • SA

    Seabridge Gold +8% as new drill program begins at KSM

    • Seabridge Gold (SA +8.1%) says it has begun exploration drilling at its KSM project in British Columbia, to expand the 515M metric ton inferred resource averaging 0.53% copper and 0.36 g/ton gold found last year at Deep Kerr.
    • SA says it also wants to test several more identified and highly prospective core zone targets which have the potential for large, high grade deposits similar to Deep Kerr, including the Iron Cap deposit at depth.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMZN

    Angie's List -4.3%; Amazon reportedly launching rival marketplace

    • Reuters reports Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) is set to launch a local services marketplace later in 2014. Angie's List (NASDAQ:ANGI) has fallen in response.
    • Angie's already faces competition from eBay's Hire local services marketplace, and has long had to contend with Yelp's free reviews.
    • Previous: Angie's List gains on BofA/Merrill upgrade
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • TAP

    Beer M&A talk creates a buzz

    • Shares of Molson Coors (TAP +5.8%) are lively on speculation the company might buy out MillerCoors from SABMiller (OTCPK:SBMRY).
    • SABMiller would need to divest U.S. assets if the company's long-rumored combination with Anheuser-Busch InBev (BUD +2.9%) is ever to come to pass.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • TS

    Tenaris -3.7% as competitor guidance a negative

    • Tenaris (TS -3.7%) is lower following downside guidance from French steel pipes maker Vallourec (OTCPK:VLOUF -8%), which reduced its 2014 EBITDA outlook by ~10% Y/Y due to soft orders in the Middle East, the North Sea and Brazil.
    • Vallourec cites a significant temporary reduction in demand for its oil and gas operations in Brazil, as Petrobras (PBR +0.5%) has decided to eliminate most of its tube inventories by year end; it says PBR was still committed to its high-value deepwater oil projects, so the impact of the inventory run-down would be a one-off for Vallourec.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: END +60%. ACHN +57%. OTC:ATEA +51%. RCPT +37%. DRL +15%. GALE +13%. RADA +13%. CHKE +12%. OTC:TLOG +12%. AMCC +12%.
    • Top 10 Losers: COUP -15%. FRAN -14%. EHTH -13%. OTC:EGLT -13%. DGLY -11%. RSH -10%. OTCQB:SURG -10%. SYN -10%. EDN -9%. EDMC -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 3 Comments
  • EHTH

    eHealth -12.8% on Jefferies downgrade

    • Jefferies has downgraded eHealth (NASDAQ:EHTH) to Hold, and cut its PT by $22 to $40.
    • Shares now -27% YTD. They fell last month following a Q1 miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZNGA

    Zynga +5.7%; UBS bullish following talk with CFO

    • After meeting with new CFO David Lee yesterday, UBS is upbeat about Zynga's (NASDAQ:ZNGA) mid-term and long-term outlook.
    • UBS: "We believe our core investment case (improved bookings growth, margin leverage from growth/cost cuts, & greater mobile focus) remains intact, and we expect Zynga to remain a beat/raise story going forward."
    • Shares fell hard last Thursday following CEO Don Mattrick's BofA/Merrill conference talk. They currently go for just 2.1x 2014E sales and 1.7x 2015E sales exc. cash/investments.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 6 Comments
  • WB

    Weibo gains on Credit Suisse launch

    • Weibo's (WB +2.7%) earnings will grow to $87M in 2015 and then double to $174M in 2016, predicts Credit Suisse's Dick Wei, launching coverage with an Outperform and $23 PT.
    • Wei also expects healthy revenue growth, as the Chinese microblogging leader's non-advertising revenue streams, such as premium memberships, e-commerce (aided by the Alibaba alliance), data licensing, and game publishing.
    • Shares +13% from their $17 April IPO price. They fell three weeks ago on disappointing Q2 guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • CSFL

    CenterState Banks boosted by Sterne Agee coverage

    • CenterStates Banks (CSFL +3.8%) is initiated with a Buy and $13.50 price target at Sterne Agee.
    • Its subsidiary CenterStates Bank of Florida just wrapped up its purchase of First Southern Bancorp and this week sold off five First Southern branches to Fidelity Bank.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • AMCC

    AppliedMicro +10.9%, Cavium +1.7%; Canaccord bullish on ARM servers

    • Canaccord's Matthew Ramsay has launched coverage of AppliedMicro (NASDAQ:AMCC) with a Buy and $16 PT, and on fellow ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) server CPU play Cavium (CAVM) with a Buy and $62 PT.
    • Ramsay sees ARM designs grabbing 20% of a 2018 server CPU market he expects will be worth $19B (up from a current $12B).
    • Though software support and the dominance of Intel's x86 CPUs act as challenges, there's plenty of optimism about the ability of ARM designs to address demand for low-power CPUs for hyperscale deployments, as well as to cater to application-specific niches better than general-purpose Intel CPUs.
    • Cavium is going after the latter opportunity with its Project Thunder CPUs - Ramsay expects strong sales growth starting in 2H15. In the near-term, he expects a 50% 2013 increase in Cavium's core network processor design wins to drive 20%+ revenue growth.
    • As for AppliedMicro, he sees the early lead for the company's X-Gene ARM CPUs - parts have been sampling for nearly a year, and plenty of software testing has been done - allowing AppliedMicro to hit its target of doubling quarterly sales by the end of 2016.
    • Cavium recently unveiled ThunderX, a next-gen solution supporting up to 48 home-grown ARM cores (requires a costly architectural license) - chips meant specifically for networking, storage, and security hardware will be offered. AppliedMicro is prepping next-gen X-Gene CPUs supporting up to 16 cores.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • CVA

    Covanta +3.6% on cost saving initiatives, dividend increase

    • Covanta (CVA +3.6%) hits a seven-month high after announcing late yesterday that it is implementing several initiatives, including a workforce reduction, expected to result in cost savings of ~$30M in 2015 and raising its quarterly dividend by 39%.
    • Wunderlich raises its price target for CVA shares to $24 from $22, noting that yesterday's news also included a reinstatement of the Dublin project; even under a conservative scenario about the final timing and success of the cost savings plus Dublin, the firm thinks the news warrants an incremental $1.50/share in valuation (Briefing.com).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • RRC

    Range Resources -3% after disclosing Q1 results excluding EQT deal

    • Range Resources (RRC -3.1%) is sharply lower after disclosing pro forma results excluding the pending transaction with EQT Corp. (EQT -1.2%); Q1 revenues would be reduced by 4% to $437M and EPS by $0.04 to $0.16.
    • RRC expect to complete the exchange of the Conger assets in Texas for the Nora oil and gas producing properties, gathering and other assets in Virginia owned by EQT on June 16 with an effective date of Jan. 1, 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • SBNY

    Signature Bank -1.5% after pricing secondary

    • Signature Bank (SBNY -1.5%) prices its 2.1M share secondary at $123.25 per share. Underwriters retain an option to buy another 315K shares at that price.
    • Previously: Signature Bank announces 2.1M share secondary
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • TTWO

    Take-Two +3.5% on GTA V announcement

    • Grand Theft Auto V will launch on the PS4, Xbox One, and PCs this fall, Take-Two (NASDAQ:TTWO) announces as the gaming industry's E3 conference continues.
    • The company promises the launches will be accompanied by "across-the-board graphical and technical improvements to deliver a stunning new level of detail." The PC version will also include "a video editor designed for advanced movie-making." (trailer video)
    • GTA V delivered a blockbuster launch for the PS3 and Xbox 360 last September, topping $1B in retail sales in its first 3 days of availability. Take-Two quickly followed up by launching Grand Theft Auto Online.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • BURL

    Burlington Stores higher after solid Q1 results

    • Burlington Stores (BURL +5.2%) trades higher after beating profit estimates with its Q1 report.
    • Comparable-store sales rose 2.7% during the period.
    • Gross margin rate +80 bps to 38.1%.
    • The company also backed its previously-issued guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • END

    Endeavour +42% on improved production guidance

    • Endeavour International (END +42.3%) raises its Q2 production guidance to 10.5K-11.5K boe/day, up from its previous guidance of 9K-10K boe/day, citing its three large U.K. assets which have been online and producing at consistent rates.
    • Regarding liquidity, END says it has executed a forward sale for $22.5M and has settled an insurance claim for the damaged Rochelle E1 well for ~$12.6M.
    • Before today's gain, the share price had been cut nearly in half since the start of the month, and management says it is unaware of any reason for the sharp drop.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games names a new CEO

    • Scientific Games (SGMS +15.9%) names Gavin Isaacs to be the company's new CEO.
    • Isaacs was previously the CEO at SHFL Entertainment until it was acquired by Bally Technology.
    • The company has a press conference scheduled for later this morning during which the new exec will answer questions.
    • Previous:  Buyout interest in International Game Technology helps to lift the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • QUOT

    Coupons.com -10.3% on Goldman downgrade

    • Goldman has cut Coupons.com (NASDAQ:COUP) to Sell following a 79% run-up from a May 8 low of $15.56 (hit following mixed Q1 numbers)
    • Shares currently go for 8.7x 2014E sales, and 6.6x 2015E sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ACHN +43%. RCPT +28%. SPEX +13%. CHS +11%. KOOL +8%. CLSN +7%. SGMS +7%. AVNR +6%.
    • Losers: RSH -12%. FRAN -10%. OTC:IGC -8%. DNDN -7%. ROYT -6%. BAS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter to offer ~$45M for Ambassador Oil, to issue 5.1M shares

    • Magnum Hunter (MHR) -2.7% premarket after disclosing that it filed with the Australian Securities Exchange a notice of intention to make a takeover offer for Ambassador Oil and Gas (OTCPK:AOIGF).
    • MHR plans to issue ~5.1M common shares to acquire 100% of Ambassador; it would offer one share of stock for every 27.8 Ambassador shares, implying total consideration of ~US$45.2M.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 14 Comments
  • CELG

    Receptos MS drug hits primary endpoint in Phase 2 trial

    • Shares of Receptos (RCPT) are up 36% premarket on higher-than-normal volume in response to the company's report on successful Phase 2 results for its selective S1P1 receptor modulator, RPC1063, for relapsing multiple sclerosis. The drug met its primary endpoint of reducing the cumulative number of gadolinium-enhancing ((GdE)) lesions determined by MRI from week 12 to week 24 of treatment. Patients on RPC1063 experienced a statistically significant reduction in GdE lesions of 86% versus placebo.
    • Patient recruitment for a Phase 3 trial is underway.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • RF

    Regions boosted by new coverage

    • Regions Financial (NYSE:RF) is up 1% in premarket action after being initiated at Overweight with $12.50 price target at Stephens.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • VGBK

    Another community bank deal: Eagle purchase Virginia Heritage

    • It's a stock and cash deal with Virginia Heritage Bank (OTCQB:VGBK) owners receiving in the area of $29 in aggregate consideration for each share of VGBK they own (vs. recent price of $21.66). The exchange ratio could be adjusted depending on what happens with Eagle Bancorp (NASDAQ:EGBN) stock.
    • Eagle expects the deal to be accretive to earnings within a year after the merger, and modestly dilutive to book value.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • IRE

    Bank of Ireland slides as Ross exits

    • "The sale of Wilbur Ross’s remaining stake in Bank of Ireland (NYSE:IRE), giving up the board seat which he held for just under three years, reinforces our view that there remains little in the way of incremental positive catalysts on the horizon," says Nomura. “Further overhang remains with over 60% of the shares in the hands of the top 10 investors, although most are in it for the long haul.”
    • Down nearly 4% in early action, Bank of Ireland is now off 2.5% in London action. The ADRs fell 2.1% in New York trade yesterday following the news.
    • Previously: Ross exiting rest of Bank of Ireland position
     
     
     
     
    | 7:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • ACHN

    More good news for Achillion

    • Demonstrating impeccable timing, Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) announces that the FDA has lifted its clinical hold on sovaprevir and initial dosing has begun with ACH-3422.
    • Results from the Phase 1 proof-of-concept trial for the uridine-analog nucleotide ACH-3422 are expected in the fall and combination studies should begin by year end.
    • Sovaprevir testing may now begin with a once-daily maximum dose of 200 mg in HCV patients and healthy volunteers. A partial hold is still in effect for multiple dose studies in healthy volunteers which will require FDA approval of the protocol before initiating.
    • Shares are up 34% premarket on higher-than-normal volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:14 AM
